attributes.action: Stop Human Rights Abuses of Brian Pead
attributes.additional_details: State persecution on an industrial scale was perpetrated against Brian and his family because the Home Office wanted to cover-up child abuse and police corruption in Lambeth and the Met.
attributes.background: In 2006, Brian Pead exposed child abuse in Lambeth Council. He was unlawfully dismissed from his job as Head Teacher and since then has been wrongly accused of being a sex offender, sent unlawfully to prison on four occasions, beaten up in the street by Police, and separated from his beloved family.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept your petition in its current form as it does not include a clear action for either the UK Government or Parliament. Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We cannot accept petitions calling for criminal investigations or prosecutions to be stopped, because the police and Director for Public Prosecutions are operationally independent.

The Independent Police Complaints Commission, not the Government or Parliament, conducts independent investigations of the police. You can find out more about the IPCC, including how to make a complaint, here:

https://www.ipcc.gov.uk/complaints
